meanings.definition: In a busy manner; actively, energetically, or diligently.
meanings.sent1: She worked busily on her homework, finishing it before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The bees buzzed busily around the garden, collecting nectar.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel busily gathered acorns, preparing for winter.
meanings.sent4: The chef chopped vegetables busily, creating a delicious stir-fry.
meanings.sent5: The children played busily in the park, laughing and running around.

meanings.sent1: The busily typing secretary answered calls and scheduled appointments.
meanings.sent2: The busily moving ants built intricate tunnels in the ground.
meanings.sent3: The busily painting artist accidentally mixed up the colors on the palette.
meanings.sent4: The busily working construction crew completed the building ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: The busily reading student absorbed information from the textbook.
